turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I need some fashion advice! I'm trying to revamp my wardrobe but I'm on a super tight budget. Like, REALLY tight.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! I can definitely help with that. To give you the best recommendations, what's your approximate budget for clothing per month? Also, what kind of style are you generally going for – casual, professional, trendy, etc.?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, let's say... $100 a month, max. And I'm aiming for a casual but put-together look. Something I can wear to run errands but also grab coffee with friends, you know?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Got it. For a $100 monthly budget and a casual, put-together style, I recommend focusing on versatile basics. Think a good pair of dark-wash jeans (check out sales at stores like Old Navy or Target), a few neutral-colored t-shirts (white, gray, black), and a comfortable cardigan or denim jacket. These can be mixed and matched. Consider thrifting for unique finds too!

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Thrifting... ugh, I always feel overwhelmed when I go. It's like a mountain of clothes! Any tips on making thrifting less awful?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, thrifting can be daunting! Try going with a specific list of items you need, and focus on those first. Shop during off-peak hours (weekday mornings are usually less crowded). Check the quality of the fabric carefully for stains or tears. And don't be afraid to try things on! Look for consignment shops too, they often have more curated selections.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's actually really helpful, thanks! But what about shoes? Shoes are expensive! Can I even get decent shoes on this budget?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, finding affordable shoes is possible! Prioritize comfort and versatility. Look for sales on basic sneakers or flats at discount retailers like DSW or Ross. You could also check online marketplaces like Poshmark or Depop for gently used options. Aim for one or two pairs that will work with most of your outfits.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, last question. What about ethical concerns? Is it even possible to be somewhat ethical in fashion with this tiny budget, considering fast fashion is often involved?
